Also note that for instantiating spatial qualities of Buildings and AccomodativeObjects, one can choose to use the aforementioned LocalizablePlace and LocalizablePlaceDescription design pattern for e.g. Address, Postcode etc. Alternatively, for e.g. longitude-latitude like data, one is advised to use the quality reification pattern. See: vph: GeographicValue and the explanation provided for the class vph:QualityValue.
To understand the difference between vph:LocalizablePlaceDescription and vph:GeographicValue, it may help to keep in mind that Descriptions depend on some CognitiveAgent and a Situation while vph:GeographicValue just captures some spatial dimension. In other words: CognitiveAgents can decide to replace some Description due to a new Situation, while QualityValues can only (at best and not always) be manipulated by some CognitiveAgent.

Note that bag:AdresseerbaarObject subsumes classes that denote both GeographicAreas and Artifacts which is not a modeling approach we adhere to in VPH as it leads to inconsistencies. Hence, we do not create any mapping here.

rs/ toekomstig geaxiomatiseerd als: *equivalentTo isDefinedBy some (Localizable)PlaceDescription.
(Dus een LocalizableArea moet 1 of meer LocalizablePlaceDescriptions hebben.)
owl:Class.skos:definition: LocalizableArea is a GeographicArea that can be identified by some LocalizablePlaceDescription such as an Address or Postcode.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: rs/ toekomstig aanvullend geaxiomeerd als: *isDescriptionOf some vph:LocalizableArea
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: LocalizablePlaceDescription is a PlaceDescription that is used to identify some LocalizableArea.
owl:Class.skos:example: Examples are postcode descriptions, roadway descriptions, domicile descriptions, etc.

owl:Class.skos:definition: sumo: Mammal is an Organism "having a constant body temperature and characterized by the presence of hair, mammary glands, and sweat glands."

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Instances of MassValue express the quantity values of the physical quality Mass.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: TO DO: add decent definition.

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Maatregel is een Plan waarin wordt bepaald of voorgeschreven welke Acties er door een Persoon of Organisatie moeten worden uitgevoerd om een ongewenst, onverwacht of niet-legaal resultaat van een ander Proces of Actie te voorkomen.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Measure is a Plan that describes or prescribes the Actions that must be carried out by some Human or Organization to prevent some unintended, unwanted or illegal outcome of some other Process or Action.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: MeasuringDevice is an Device that has as purpose to serve as an instrument in deriving some QuantitativeMeasurementValue.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Meetinstrument is een fysiek hulpmiddel dat als doel heeft om als instrument te worden gebruikt bij het vaststellen van een hoeveelheid van iets (specifiek: een QuantitativeMeasurementValue).

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
TO DO (pleisters, gaas, verbanden, etc)
Nodig voor: vph:WoundcareTherapeuticIntervention

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Instances of MedicalClassificationSystem are descriptive structures that provide some shared organization and definition of Human health and functioning levels in the broadest sense.

Wikipedia: 'MedicalDoctor is a HealthcareProfessionRole of a human who practises medicine, which is concerned with promoting, maintaining, or restoring health through the study, diagnosis, prognosis and treatment of disease, injury, and other physical and mental impairments.'
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: MedicalPrescription is the written authorization of some HealthcareProvider for some Person to purchase a prescription drug from a Pharmacist.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: MedicalRatingQuality is a MeasurableIntrinsicQuality that characterizes the severity, stage or level of some DiseaseOrSyndrome or BiologicalQuality in some Organism.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An example data value is e.g. '85%', which can be the value of the general performance of some human being in daily activities, assessed with the Barthel scale as a MedicalClassificationSystem.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Instances of MedicalRatingValue express values for some quality based on some medical classification or rating system.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Voorbeelden zijn: brace, spalk, mitella, etc.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: MedischeStabilisator is een concreet Hulpmiddel dat wordt toegepast om te voorkomen dat een Persoon een gedeelte van zijn lichaam kan bewegen om herstel te bevorderen danwel verdere fysieke schade te voorkomen.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Brancard is een Transportmiddel waarmee een Persoon horizontaal gedragen en/of verplaatst kan worden.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: MedicalStretcher is a TransportationDevice for the horizontal Translocation of a Person .

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Meeting is an IntentionalProcess where two or more CognitiveAgent are (digitally) together for the purpose of communication.
owl:Class.skos:example: examples: a lecture, a board meeting, a team meeting, a conference, a wedding, a funeral, a teleconference, a consultation, etc.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Examples of MercantileOrganization are shops such as Drugstore, GroceryStore and MedicalWholesale.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Handelsonderneming is een Bedrijf dat met een winstoogmerk FysiekeObjecten of een service verkoopt aan Personen en/of Organisaties.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: MercantileOrganization is a Business that sells PhysicalObjects or services to customers for a profit.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Method is systematic description on the way of doing something in an orderly and logical arrangement.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Also see (Dutch only): https://www.rijksoverheid.nl/onderwerpen/arbeidsovereenkomst-en-cao/vraag-en-antwoord/welke-contracten-zijn-er-voor-oproepkrachten
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: MinMaxArbeidscontract is een Arbeidscontract waarin staat vastgelegd wat het minimum en maximum aantal uren is waarvoor een Werknemer oproepbaar is voor het verrichten van werkzaamheden.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Ministerie is een Overheidsorganisatie die onder de leiding van een minister het regeringsbeleid voorbereidt en uitvoert op een specifiek bestuursgebied.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Ministry is a GovernmentOrganization that operates under the direction of a minister and prepares and carries out policy on some domain.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Voorbeelden zijn: rollators, loophekken, krukken, etc.

Zie ook: vph:TransportationDevice/vph:Transportmiddel.
Instanties van vph:MobiliteitsHulpmiddel zoals krukken en rollators ondersteunen de autonome verplaatsing van een Persoon op basis van eigen lichaamskracht maar zijn geen vervanging daarvan.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: MobiliteitsOnderstreunendMiddel is een ondersteunend hulpmiddel waarmee een Persoon met een beperkte fysieke mobiliteit zichzelf kan verplaatsen zonder de hulp van andere Personen.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: MobilityDevice is a Device that assists a Person with some physical impairment to translocate independently of help of other Persons.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: MunicipalityArea is a GeopoliticalArea that covers the area governed by some MunicipalityGovernment.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Gemeentebestuur is een Overheidsorganisatie die een GeografischGebied bestuurt, meer specifiek een gebied dat kan bestaan uit een Stad, meerdere Dorpen of een stad en meerdere dorpen.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: MunicipalityGovernment is a GovernmentOrganization that manages some GeographicArea that consists of a City, some Villages or a city and some villages.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: NeglectAbusiveEvent is any AbusiveEvent where some Human willfully does not provide some form of care and attention to some other Human which harms or may harm the emotional and/or physical well-being and safety of that other Human.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Neighbour is the Role of some Human and corresponds to the mutual relation someone has to some other Human living next door.

Neoplasm is a PathologicalAnatomicalEntity "that consists of uncontrolled autonomous cell-proliferation which can occur in any part of the body as a benign or malignant neoplasm (tumor)."
Source: Human Phenotype Ontology (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_0002664).
SUMO: Instances of this Class are UnitsOfMeasure that are applied to a single dimension, and so are not intrinsically defined by the functional composition of other units.
DOLCE: An endurant with no mass, generically constantly depending on some agent. Non-physical endurants can have physical constituents (e.g. in the case of members of a collection).

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
An example of a classification system is the European Qualification Framework that can be used to assign some value for the educational level of a nurse. This framework is a norm according to which some normative value is assigned, in this case e.g. 'Level 4'.
Also see: vph:ClassificationSystem.
By definition, instances of NormativeValue do not express values that are intrinsic to any entity.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Instances of NormativeValue express values of abstract qualities that are derived, assigned or assessed via some shared classification and/or normative system.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Gezin is een FamilieGroep die bestaat uit een of twee ouders en een of meerdere kinderen.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: NuclearFamily is a FamilyGroup consisting of one or two parents and their child or children.
Wikipedia: Nurse is the HealthcareProfessionRole of a human focuses on the care of individuals, families and communities so they may attain, maintain, or recover optimal health and quality of life.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Leerling-Verpleegkundige is de Rol van een Persoon die in het kader van de Wet Educatie- en Beroepsonderwijs een HBO-duale zorgopleiding volgt en een Arbeidsovereenkomst heeft met een Zorgorganisatie.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: NurseApprentice is the Role of a Human who works as an Employee for some CareOrganization and receives on-the-job training and supervision while following an accompanying educational program to obtain a professional qualification as Nurse.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Voor de Nederlandse situatie: een Verzorgende valt, anders dan een Verpleegkundige, niet onder de Tuchtraad en kent geen registratie in het BIG-register.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: NursingAssistant is the HealthcareProfessionRole of a Human who assist individuals with health care needs with their activities of daily living and who provides basic nursing procedures under the supervision of a nurse or other health care professional.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Verzorgende is de Rol van een Persoon die verpleegtechnische en verzorgende taken verricht voor een client of een groep clienten binnen een zorginstelling.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Helpende is de Rol van een Persoon die binnen een zorginstelling huishoudelijke taken verricht, helpt bij de persoonlijke verzorging van patienten en mede zorg draagt voor hun welzijn.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: NursingHelper is the Role of a Human who assists with housekeeping within a care instituation, helps with the personal care of patients and who is co-responsible for the general well-being patients.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Anno 2020 moet een Persoon een WLZ indicatie van 5 (VV) of hoger hebben om zorg te ontvangen van een VerpleeghuisOrganisatie.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: NursingHomeOrganization is a CareOrganization that provides clustered accomodation, nursing, care and assistance with activities of daily living for Persons who are (temporary) unable to care for themselves due to a handicap, illness or condition.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: VerpleeghuisOrganisatie is een ZorgOrganisatie die zich richt op het geclusterd verlenen van woonruimte en intensieve zorg en verpleging voor Personen die door ziekte of beperking (tijdelijk) niet in staat zijn zelfstandig te wonen.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Note that all Organisms require some form of Nutrient, though the kind of required and synthesizable nutrient can be specific for some biologic kingdom e.g. Plants versus Animals.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Nutrient is a BiologicallyActiveSubstance that is necessary for providing energy and maintaining the normal biologic functioning of some Organism.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: OccupationalRole is the Role of a Human who has had some form of professional training or a specific education and has the credentials to carry out a set of skilled tasks.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Oproepkracht is de Rol van een Persoon die op afroep arbeid verricht voor een ander Persoon of Organisatie in ruil voor een financiële compensatie en waarbij de onderlinge afspraken, rechten en plichten zijn vastgelegd in een Arbeidscontract.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Optician is the Role of a Human who fits and supplies corrective lenses for the correction of a person's vision.

FMA: "Anatomical structure, each instance of which has a maximal complement of instances of two or more types of tissue or one or more types of essential morphologic unit, a predominantly bona fide boundary and intrinsic vasculature and neural network. Examples: liver, lung, kidney, stomach, urinary bladder, gall bladder."

FMA: "Anatomical structure, each instance of which has as its direct parts instances of one or more organ types which are interconnected with one another by zones of continuity. Examples: nervous system, cardiovascular system, alimentary system."

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: OrganicObject is a CorpuscularObject that is considered to come in existence, live and die. This class encompasses Organisms such as 'animal' and 'tree' as well as AnatomicalStructures such as 'liver' and 'leaf'.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
For a scientifically motivated taxonomy for Organisms we refer to e.g. the NCBI . Here, we included a basic set of subclasses covering only a coarse grained categorization of Organisms.
Note that taxonomies for species may follow a different approach for conceptual specialization based on sets and members and not subclasses!
For the owl version: http://www.obofoundry.org/ontology/ncbitaxon.html Online browser (no uris): https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Taxonomy/Browser/wwwtax.cgi
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Organism is an OrganicObject that can function or act independently.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Note that sub organizations such as 'department' or a 'advisory board' are an Organization as well. For instance, 'Amsterdam Academic Hospital' is an instance of Organization, more specifically an instance of HospitalOrganization. Their Cardiology Department is an instance of CareOrganization while the Bookkeeping Department is an instance of e.g. AccountingOrganization.
To define that these instances are part of a larger Organization, we will be using a property such as 'vph:hasSubOrganization'/'vph:isSubOrganizationOf'. This means that the number of different departments of some Organization can be inferred from the number of subOrganization properties to another instance classified as Organization. Also, the number of sub organizations not considered to be concerned with Cure or Care can be counted easily as well.
Note that a set of generic (data) properties will be defined for Organization. As such, the Accounting Department in our example is defined as subOrganization of the Amsterdam Academic Hospital but may have a different address, while some 'advisory board' shares the address of the hospital but is not part of the Organization (it is an external Organization).
What should or should not be considered a sub organization specifically within the Nursing Home care domain, and on what grounds, should be determined and defined outside the ontology. The ontology is deliberately not restricive in this.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Organization is a GroupOfHumans that consists of two or more Persons who work together for a particular purpose.

Wikipedia: "Organisatie is een doelgerichte samenbundeling van kennis, vaardigheden en kracht tussen meerdere personen die primair middelen en activiteiten aanwendt om te voorzien in de behoefte aan producten en/of diensten in haar omgeving. "

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
TO DO: alle gebeurtenissen bij een organisatie die leiden tot een verandering in de organisatie wat betreft het operationele proces, het personeelsleden en hun functies. Dus: fusies, promoties, demoties, aanstellen en ontslagen, faillisementen.
Aan de lezer: overnames horen bij vph:FinancialTransaction, processen zoals 'managen' komen bij vph:Process (immers: geen inherente verandering in de werkelijkheid).
TO DO: fusies van organisaties.

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Bedheffer is een Mobiliteitshulpmiddel dat bestaat uit een driehoekige greep die boven een bed hangt en waarmee een Persoon zichzelf van het bed kan oprichten.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: OverbedTrapeze is a triangular-shaped MobilityDevice that hangs over some bed and helps a Person to raise herself from the bed.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Note that only few interventions are intrinsically palliation-focused, meaning that a manifold of TherapeuticInterventions can be considered a PalliativeIntervention depending on context and interpretation. Therefore, VPH deliberately allows to type some intervention such as 'administer morphine' as both some AdministerTherapeuticSubstance and some PalliativeIntervention.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: PalliativeIntervention is any TherapeuticIntervention carried out with the intention to alleviate or reduce (the symptoms of) some DiseaseOrSyndrome of a PatientInCare who is terminally ill and/or in a life-threatening condition.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Parent is the Role of some Human who has or has had at least one descendent.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
The class Participant is further specialized in so called case roles. Case roles are semantic roles played by participants of an event or situation. Note that the use of case roles is fully optional but allows for finegrained data retrieval on event participants.
Our definition of case roles follows the theory of the linguist Charles Fillmore. In short, case roles describe what role some entity plays in an event, e.g. if it is doing something, undergoing something or using something. In this ontology, we use case role as a specification of the general role Participant.
For example, in the sentence 'Mary hit John with vase', we have three participants: Mary, John and a vase. With case roles, you can specify the semantic role of the participants: 'Mary' is the Agent, 'John' the Patient and 'the vase' the Theme.
Having case roles for participants of an event allows for specific queries that ask for e.g. all persons participating in some reported agressive incident in the role of AgentCaseRole or PatientCaseRole. In other words: ultimately it allows to specify whether a) some PatientInCare hit a Caregiver or b.) some Caregiver hit a PatientIncare or c) some PatientInCare hit another PatientInCare.
Also see: Fillmore, Charles J. (April 1967). "The case for case". Proceedings of the Texas Symposium, on Language Universals.
For a fine-grained implementation of case roles, see FrameNet: https://framenet.icsi.berkeley.edu/fndrupal/.
This ontology defined a limited set of caseroles that specify the more general role Participant. Note that the use of caseroles is not mandatory.
This is the top node of the ontology.

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Partner is the Role of some Human and corresponds to the relation someone has to another Human where both contend to share intimacy and significant parts of their personal lives.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: PathologicAnatomicalEntity is an AnatomicalEntity which is not normally found in the Organism of which it is a part, and it is the result of some PathologicProcess.

OGMS: "An anatomical structure (FMA) is pathological whenever (1) it has come into being as a result of changes in some pre-existing canonical anatomical structure, (2) through processes other than the expression of the normal complement of genes of an organism of the given type, and (3) is predisposed to have health-related consequences for the organism in question manifested by symptoms and signs."

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
TO DO: ziek zijn/worden, atrofie, vermageren, jeuk, delier, overgeven, voedselvergiftiging, koortsaanvallen, etc.
(Any disordered process, activity, or state of the Organism as a whole, of a body system or systems, or of multiple Organs or Tissues. Included here are normal responses to a negative stimulus as well as patholologic conditions or states that are less specific than a disease. Pathologic functions frequently have systemic effects.")
Verwijs naar vph:Symptom en vph:DiseaseOrSyndrome.

Examples:
"THE LAKE froze to depths of 6 feet." "Mary hit JOHN with a baseball bat."
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: A PatientCaseRole is played by a participant of some Process where participant undergoes/is affected by/changed by some Process in the broadest sense.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: PatientInCare is the Role of a Human who receives professional care and assistance with activities of daily life by some CareOrganization.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
As a more formal definition and explanation: Perdurants are only partially present at some point in time and extend in time by accumulating different temporal parts. For example "driving his car to Amsterdam" consist of different temporal parts or phases: driving his car at time 1, 2 and 3. As such, the driving accumulates temporal parts while the driving at time 1 and 2 are no longer present at time 3.
In VPH, Perdurants are further specialized into EventivePerdurant and StativePerdurant following the modeling approach in DOLCE. The difference can be explained and illustrated as follows:
-A perdurant is considered an EventivePerdurant if it is cumulative: "selling this car at time 1" and "selling this car at time 2 implies two different sellings.
-A perdurant is considered a StativePerdurant if it is not cumulative: "owning this car at time 1" and "owning this car at time 2" does result in one owning a car and not two.
StativePerdurant has two subclasses: State and Process. State is considered homeomeric while Process is not. This can be explained with an example "owning a car" (State) versus "driving a car" (Process). Driving has temporal parts that are not driving (e.g. stopping, accelarating) while every temporal part of owning a car is the same owning a car.
Note that expressions in Natural Language that relate to Perdurants show different complementation and aspectual structures that indicate whether some expression is to be understood as e.g. an EventivePerdurant or a StativePerdurant. For example: "John is driving his car" would be considered a Process while "John drove his car to Amsterdam" would indicate an EventivePerdurant. In VPH, we deliberately abstract over these distinctions and realizations in Natural Language. As a rule of thumb, we define a class such as vph:Translocation as a subclass of EventivePerdurant since we consider translocations (e.g. drive, fly, walk) to be intrinsically cumulative.

As a more straightforward explanation: Perdurants are things that happen such as 'stitching a wound' and 'hiring a registered nurse'. If the thing that is happening has always and intrinsically a result or leads to some change in the world, it is likely to be an EventivePerdurant. If there is no clear result or change in the world other than not happening at all, it is likely to be a StativePerdurant.
For example:
-What will always be the case if some [Perdurant] happened?
Buying. Result: always implies a change of ownership. Thus: EventivePerdurant. Kill. Result: always implies that someone died. Thus: EventivePerdurant. Increase: Result: always implies that there is more of something than before. Thus: EventivePerdurant.
Sleep. No clear result other than not sleeping, no clear change in the world. Thus: StativePerdurant. Meet. No clear result other than not meeting, no clear change in the world. Thus: StativePerdurant. Cry. No clear result other than not crying, no clear change in the world. Thus: StativePerdurant.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Perdurant
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Perdurants are entities that unfold in time and have only temporal parts.
owl:Class.skos:example: 'run', 'think', 'inflation', 'volcanic eruption', 'meeting', 'celebrate', 'hospitalize', 'heal', 'election'.

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Arbeidsovereenkomst is een Overeenkomst tussen een Werknemer en een Werkgever waarbij de Werknemer in dienst van de Werkgever, voor onbepaalde tijd, enerzijds verplicht is om (persoonlijk) arbeid te verrichten en anderzijds de werkgever verplicht is loon aan de werknemer te betalen.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: PersoonlijkOpleidingsplan is een Plan waarbij een Organisatie en een Medewerker beschrijven en overeenkomen wanneer en welke opleidingen en cursussen worden gevolgd met als doel het kennisniveau van de Medewerker op peil te houden of verder uit te breiden.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
This class is exclusively for PharmaceuticalArtifacts, i.e. specific drugs that consist of one or more TherapeuticSubstances. For example: Ritalin is an instance of PharmaceuticalArtifact and contains methylfenidate as its TherapeuticSubstance.
Note that some Human may be allergic or have an intolerance for some PharmaceuticalArtifact, but not the TherapeuticSubstance.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: PharmaceuticalArtifact is an Artifact that is made and distributed with the intention to manage, cure, prevent or stabilize some PathologicProcess in a Human.

Wikipedia: 'Pharmacist is the HealthcareProfessionRole of a Human who is an expert in the use of medicines and deals with the composition, effects, mechanism of action and proper and effective use of drugs.'

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
This concept will not be of importance for the Cure or Care domain. The rationale for adding this class is to maintain conceptual consistency for future domain extensions.
Note that human activity may be the cause of some phenomenous event to happen, e.g. an earthquake may be caused by excessive drilling and mining activities.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: PhenomenousEvent is an EventivePerdurant that occurs due to some natural force or agent and without the active participation of some SentientAgent.
owl:Class.skos:example: Examples are: earthquakes, vulcanic eruptions, tsunamis, floodings, inundations, epidemics, pandemics, etc.

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: PhysicalAbusiveEvent is any AbusiveEvent that is willfully carried out by some Human with the intention to physically harm some other Human.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
PhysicalEndurant is comparable to ufo:Substantial; note that this class is not in Gufo. Also see: http://dev.nemo.inf.ufes.br/seon/UFO.html#UFO_Substantial_detail
The motivation for this class is primarily the differences in Unity criteria which is -U for Substance (water, blood, toothpaste) and +U for Physical Objects (faucet, vein, toothbrush). PhysicalObjects are usually made up by some Substance (in case of artifacts) or consist of some Substance. Substances have no clear boundaries while PhysicalObjects usually do.
cf: 'clay' (-U) and 'brick' (+U); 'marble' (-U) and 'marble sculpture' (+U).
owl:Class.skos:definition: dolce: "An endurant having a direct physical (at least spatial) quality."

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
PhysicalObject is currently specialized in Collections (Objects that have members such as an organization or a forest) and CorpuscularObject (Objects that can have parts that have different properties from the whole, such as a human or a tree).
A third potential subclass is currently not modeled in this Ontology since it does not seem to play a role in the Care and Cure domain: SelfConnectedObject. SelfConnectedObject is an Object that carries Unity, has no members and its parts carry the same properties as the whole. Examples are e.g. Iceberg and Ocean. Note the difference with vph:Substance (e.g. Water) that carries no Unity.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: PhysicalObject is an Endurant that does not depend on other PhysicalObjects for its existence.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Deze klasse bestrijkt die fysieke objecten die primair ontwikkeld zijn om de bewegingsvrijheid van een Persoon te beperken. Voor Handelingen die als 'vrijheidsbeperkend' kunnen worden ingezet of als zodanig kunnen worden gezien, zoals 'bedhek plaatsen' verwijzen we naar vph:Handeling en naar vph:VrijheidsBeperkendeMaatregel.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: MobiliteitsBeperkendMiddel is een Hulpmiddel dat er primair voor bedoeld is om een Persoon te beperken in haar bewegingsvrijheid om letsel en/of gevaarlijke situaties voor de Persoon en/of Personen in de omgeving te voorkomen.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: PhysicalRestraintDevice is a Device that is intended to restrain some Person in order to prevent injury and/or a unsafe situations for the Person herself and/or other Persons.
owl:Class.skos:example: Voorbeelden zijn: Zweedse band, Bratexband, polsband, enkelband.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Instances of PhysicalValue are atomic regions or qualia in some value space. Our conception of PhysicalValue comes close to dul:PhysicalRegion where the focus is on the region, not the qualia.
Due to this difference, we defined no mapping from this class to DOLCE.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Instances of PhysicalValue express values of physical qualities such as Weight, Acidity and BodyPosition.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: PhysiologicProcess is a BiologicalProcess that takes place in some Organism and is considered as a normal biological functioning within that Organism.

Wikipedia: 'Physiotherapist is the HealthcareProfessionRole of a Human who addresses the illnesses, or injuries that limit a person's abilities to move and perform functional activities in their daily lives.'

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Also see the explanation provided for the class vph:LocalizableArea for the use of vph:SpatialValue and vph:LocalizablePlaceDescription.
The rationale behind this class is to allow for Descriptions of some Area such as an AddressDescription or an InternetAddressDescription. Note that Descriptions differ from QualityValues!
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: PlaceDescription is an IdentifierDescription that is used to identify some area by means of some Description, i.e. not a SpatialValue or GeographicValue.
sumo: "A specification of a sequence of Processes which is intended to satisfy a specified purpose at some future time."
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Plant is an Organism that has cellolose cell walls and (usually) chlorophyll.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Note that some PlantAnatomicallyEntities are typically associated with having a FoodRole, e.g. 'apple' and 'banana' ( both anatomical reproductive plant entities).
Also note that in Natural Language, plant organisms and their anatomical entity may share the same word, e.g. 'apple' refers to 1. the tree species Malus domestica and (vph:Plant) 2. a fruit produced by this tree (vph:PlantAnatomicalEntity)
Likewise: 'banana', 'beet', 'lettuce', 'corn', 'onion', etc.
owl:Class.skos:definition:
AnatomicalEntity is an OrganicObject "which is generated by coordinated expression of the Plants own genes that guide its morphogenesis; has inherent 3D shape; its parts are connected and spatially related to one another in patterns determined by coordinated gene expression."
Definition derived from: The Foundational Model of Anatomy Ontology (FMA). (http://purl.org/sig/ont/fma.owl)
owl:Class.skos:example: Examples are apple (the fruit, not the tree), leaf, root, pollen, seed, xylem, etc.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Policy
owl:Class.skos:definition: sumo:Policy is (the contents of) a type of Declaring created and enforced by an Organization such as a government or a business, which contains guiding principles or a plan or course of action adopted by that organization.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Also see the notes provided for the class vph:Substance.
Note that sumo:Tissue is (-U), while fma:PortionOfTissue is (+U).
owl:Class.skos:definition: FMA: "Anatomical structure, each instance of which has as its parts some cells of predominantly one type with or without intercellular matrix. Examples: portion of epithelium, portion of muscle tissue, portion of connective tissue, portion of neural tissue."

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: To be used for the Quality and quality region pattern to describe e.g. that some PressureUlcer is positioned on the left hip of some patient. Note that e.g. 'left hip' is a datatype string of PositionalValue. Alternatively, see vph:PositionalValue for some reusable and standardized vocabularies for specific PositionalValues such as 'dorsal', 'left upper arm', etc.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: PositionalQualities are a (X) that characterizes the orientation or position of some entity in relation to some other entity.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Instances of PositionalValues are SpatialValues that characterize the orientation of some entity in relation to some other entity, e.g. 'Left', 'Upstairs', 'Dorsal', 'Upper right arm'.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A PostcodeArea often falls within some GeopoliticalArea such as a District, Municipality or CityOrVillage. Note however that a PostcodeArea has no legislative or adminsitrative body while GeopoliticalAreas do.
owl:Class.skos:definition: PostcodeArea is a LocalizableArea that is identified by some PostcodeDescription.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: aanvullend geaxiomeerd als: *isLocalizablePlaceDescriptionOf some vph:PostcodeArea
TO DO

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: GemotoriseerdVoertuig is een Voertuig dat is uitgerust met een motor of accusysteem voor de aandrijving.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: PoweredVehicle is a Vehicle that is equipped with some engine or some power component.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Note that this class covers dishes, prepared drinks and processed food, i.e. any Substance, PlantAnatomicalStructure and/or AnimalAnatomicalStructure that has been altered in some intentional way by Humans into some Artefact to be ingested. Hence, an apple (the fruit) is not considered a PreparedFoodArtifact while 'apple pie' or 'apple juice' is.
As an additional example, one can consider 'goat milk' as a PreparedFoodArtifact if it is pasteurized and skimmed, while it should be considered a BodySubstance in the context of mammal anatomy.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: PreparedFoodArtifact is some manipulated OrganicObject and/or Substance intended for ingestion by e.g. Humans in order to be metabolized into energy and body tissue.
owl:Class.skos:example: Examples are: cappuccino, lasagne, chocolate, icecream, hotdog, tomato soup, etc.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Note that some Human can have one or multiple pressure ulcers at different locations on the body and in different stages of severity. For the overall condition of 'having one or multiple pressure wounds' which is called 'decubitus' in Dutch, we refer to the editor notes provided for the class vph:DiseaseOrSyndrome.
Note that assigning some severity level (e.g. debitus stage 4) may be applied to the overall condition 'decubitus' (instance of DiseaseOrSyndrome, inhering in some Organism) AND/OR the individual pressure ulcers (also inhering in some Organism). VPH allows both, but it may be something to check and decide upon with Praktijk&Afspraken.
Vraag is: als een patient decubitus type 4 heeft: is er dan 1 wond met die categorie? Zo ja, dan vraagt men naar individuele wonden. Dan: vph:PressureUlcer. of: als een patient decubitus type 4 heeft: zijn er dan mogelijk ook andere wonden van een lagere categorie, maar de hoogste telt? Dan: DiseaseOrSyndrome, met decubitus als instance.
Het mag ook allebei, zolang als de aanbieder maar specificeert of hij het over de individuele wond heeft, of over de aandoening.
For instantiating Qualities with the QualityRegion design pattern, we refer to vph:QualityValue for an explanation and some examples.
owl:Class.skos:definition: PressureUlcer is a Lesion that comprises (wikipedia) "localised damage to the skin and/or underlying tissue that usually occur over a bony prominence as a result of usually long-term pressure, or pressure in combination with shear or friction. "

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Examples are cooking recipes, work instructions and descriptions of administrative procedures.
Note that performing or carrying out some Procedure is not a Description but a Perdurant.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Procedure is a sequence-dependent specification of actions involved to achieve some intended result.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Also see the definition and explanation provided for the class vph:Perdurant.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Process is StativePerdurant that is not homeomeric, i.e. parts of a Process are not the Process itself.
owl:Class.skos:example: Examples are: run.v, treat someone.v, treatment.n, manage a company.v, examinate.v, trial.n, meeting.n, etc.

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: A ProcessualRole corresponds to the manner in which a single participant behaves in some process.
owl:Class.definitionSource: cf: Loebe, F. (2007). Abstract vs. social roles–Towards a general theoretical account of roles. Applied Ontology, 2(2), 127-158.

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: ProfessionalLegalGuardian is the ProfessionRole of a Person who has the legal authority and the corresponding duties to care for the property interests of other Persons.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Protecting is an IntentionalProcess that is carried out with the intention to decrease the chance of some Damaging or Injuring or Destruction to happen to some Object or Agent.
owl:Class.skos:example: Examples: guarding.v, safeguard.v, shield.v, etc.

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Protein is a Nutrient that consists of organic compounds that are used by some Organism to maintain normal biological functions.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: ProvinceArea is a GeopoliticalArea that covers the area governed by some ProvinceGovernment.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: TO DO // added 4-08-20. See: ProvinceArea.

owl:Class.skos:definition: Wikipedia: Psychiatrist is a MedicalDoctor who specializes in psychiatry, the branch of medicine devoted to the diagnosis, prevention, study, and treatment of mental disorders.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: PsychoActiveSubstance is a TherapeuticSubstance that changes the functioning of the human brain in such way that it may result in intended alterations in perception, mood, consciousness, cognition, or behaviour.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: PsychoStimulantSubstance is a PsychoActiveSubstance that increases activity of the human central nervous system which may lead to an elevated mood, increased alertness and/or arousal.
owl:Class.skos:example: Examples are: cafeine, cocaine, methylfenidate, amphetamine, deanol, etc.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: TO DO

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: PublicArea is a GeopoliticalArea that is owned by some GovernementOrganization.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: For instantiating Qualities with the QualityRegion design pattern, we refer to vph:QualityValue for an explanation and some examples.
To ensure interoperability with the Istandards that is based on Onto-UML and thereby UFO/Gufo, we adhere to the class hierarchy for qualities as proposed in these ontologies.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Quality
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Qualities are entities that can be observed, experienced or measured and that are dependent on some other entity to exist.
owl:Class.skos:example: length, color, size, weight, fragility, happiness, dead, blind, alive, damagedness.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Say we want to state that some person weighs 54 kilo. There are basically two options to model this: directly with a data property or via reification of the quality value.
In the case of a data property, we would say someting like : DataPropertyDomain (vph:hasWeight vph:Person) DataPropertyRange (vph:hasWeight xsd:integer)
The use of the 'hasWeight' dataproperty has now been restricted by defining a specific domain and range. However, the meaning of the hasWeight property may vary within and across domains while the specific values may also be expressed in other data types. This approach hampers a.) interoperabilty across different models and b.) the annotation of heterogeneous data.
With reification via QualityValues, we make the shared conceptualization of Weight explicit. With this, we can say that Person has quality Weight and that Weight has a MassValue. The data value of this MassValue is '54'.
Also, the ontology provides units of measure that allow to define that '54' uses 'kilo' as unit of measure. If another person has the same MassValue of 54 but measured in 'stone', we know that we are still talking about a MassValue but the difference in UnitOfMeasure indicates that the two '54' data values point at a different weight.
All subclasses of QualityValue will adhere to this pattern.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Instances of QualityValue are the reified values of some quality that itself inheres in some instance of SpatioTemporalParticular.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Instances of QuantitativeMeasurementValue are derived with some measurement device and may or may not be the result of some action of a cognitive agent. In other words: some oxygen saturation value may be outputted by a permanent body sensor or measured by an intentional human action.

Instances of QuantitativeMeasurementValue are usually expressed in combination with some individual UnitOfMeasure. For example, '100 meters' combines a datatype for some LengthQuality combined with a specific UnitOfMeasure ('meter') used to express Lenght measurements.
This ontology does NOT make any formal commitment towards combining QuantitativeMeasurementValues with some UnitOfMeasurement; this implies that the model is open to nominal quantity values such as 'a lot', 'heavy', and 'cold'.
also see: vph:UnitOfMeasurement
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Instances of QuantitativeMeasurement Value express the quantity values of physical qualities such as Length, Mass and Volume as derived by some measurement process or action.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: TO DO: increases, decreases, fluctuations.
Toegevoegd voor hergebruik van bag:Spoorbaan.
TO DO

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Rape is a SexualAbusiveEvent where some Human willfully and intentionally enforces some other Human to undergo or participate in some form of sexual activity without the consent of this other Human.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Receipt is a FinancialDocument that contains a written acknowledgment that some article or service has been received and exchanged in return for some amount of money.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Examples:
"Yesterday, Mary mailed the letter to JOHN." "JOHN received a letter in the mail."
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: A RecipientCaseRole is played by a participant of some Process and is the intended target of some transfer service.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An example data value is e.g. 'certainly', which can be the value some human assigns to the likelihood he would recommend some care institution to friends and family.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Instances of RecommandationValue are values assigned by some cognitive agent and express the likelihood of recommending some object or intentional proces to others.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: RehabilitationCentre is a CareOrganization focused on the diagnosis and treatment of Persons with some physical impairment or disability.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: RevalidatieCentrum is een Zorginstelling gericht op het diagnosticeren en behandelen van Personen met een functiebeperking.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
The main discriminative feature of Relational Roles is that they are dependent on the existence and relation to another Role while this dependence is mutual. For example, carrying the role Brother can only exist and is dependant on the existence of another entity that carries the role Brother.
A Natural Language test would be: 'you can not be an X (friend/employer/...) on your own or without some someone else being X or Y (friend/employee)'.
owl:Class.skos:definition: Loebe (2007): A RelationalRole corresponds to the way in which some Entity participates in some relation.
owl:Class.definitionSource: Loebe, F. (2007). Abstract vs. social roles–Towards a general theoretical account of roles. Applied Ontology, 2(2), 127-158.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The role Relative is broadly defined and is intended to capture all roles someone can carry in the context of what can be considered 'family' across different cultures.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Relative is the Role of some Human and corresponds to the kinship someone carries in relation to some other Human, whether through common ancestry, marriage or adoption.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: (moving-residence / verhuizingen, etc)
For therapeutic procedures focused on the removal of body tissue, we refer to vph:TherapeuticIntervention and its subclasses.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: RemovingEvent is an TransferEvent where some PhysicalObject or Substance is removed from some location.
owl:Class.skos:example: Examples: remove.v, evacuate.v, clean.v., flush.v, rinse.v, empty.v, etc.

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Report is a physical or digital Document that describes the findings of a study or experiment, or a series of observations.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: For the Dutch healthcare situation, several specific and pre-defined RequiredCareAgreements exist that describe so-called 'care profiles'. A set of these have been added as Individuals.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Een Zorgprofiel is een Overeenkomst van het soort en de hoeveelheid landurige zorg en begeleiding die een Persoon nodig heeft met een somatische of psychogeriatrische aandoening of -beperking of een verstandelijke, lichamelijke of zintuiglijke handicap.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: RequiredCareAgreement is an Agreement that describes the type and amount of long term care and assistence that some Person needs and is entitled to who is physically and/or mentally challenged or has some chronic disease.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Anno 2020 moet een Persoon een WLZ indicatie van 4 (VV) of hoger hebben om zorg te ontvangen van een VerzorgingshuisOrganisatie.
For the Dutch situation: Persons are admitted with a so called 'WLZ indication' of 4 or higher.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: ResidentialCareHome is a CareOrganization that provides clustered accomodation, care and assistance with activities of daily living for Persons who are (temporary) unable to care for themselves due to a handicap, illness or condition.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: VerzorgingshuisOrganisatie is een ZorgOrganisatie die zich richt op het geclusterd verlenen van woonruimte, zorg en begeleiding bij het uitvoeren van dagelijkse activiteiten voor Personen die door ziekte of handicap (tijdelijk) niet in staat zijn zelfstandig te wonen.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: RetailOrganization is a MercantileOrganization that sells PhysicalObjects to Persons.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: WinkelOrganisatie is een Handelsonderneming die FysiekeObjecten verkoopt aan Personen.

sumo: Roadway is the subclass of LandTransitArea "that are areas intended for surface travel by self-powered, wheeled vehicles, excluding those that travel on tracks. Roadways have been at least minimally improved to enable the passage of vehicles. Roadways include dirt and gravelled roads, paved streets, and expressways."

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: A Role is a NonPhysicalObject that is played by some Endurant and depends on some context.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: We refer to SnoMed for a subhierarchy of rooms such as kitchen, bedroom and bathroom; see provided URL.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Room is a StationaryArtifact consisting of walls, a floor and a ceiling and is a functionally dependent and located in a Building.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Instances of SatisfactionValue are values that some human assigns to some qualitative aspect of an object or intentional process.

Let op: deze Klasse beschrijft een Overeenkomst tussen een Organisatie in de rol van 'inlener' en een Uitzendbureau in de rol van 'uitzender' over het beschikbaar stellen van arbeidskrachten van het Uitzendbureau voor het uitvoeren van werkzaamheden bij de inlener. Zie ook: vph:Uizendcontract.
Note that this Contract describes the terms and conditions between some Organization and an EmploymentAgency.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Detacheringsovereenkomst of Uitzendovereenkomst is een Contract waarin de onderlinge rechten, plichten en verantwoordelijkheden zijn vastgelegd tussen twee Organisaties over het tijdelijk uitvoeren van een opdracht door een Werknemer van de ene Organisatie bij een andere Organisatie.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Gedetacheerde is de Rol van een persoon die in dienst is van een Organisatie en wordt uitgeleend aan een andere Organisatie om daar voor een bepaalde tijd werkzaamheden te verrichten.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: SecondmentWorker is the Role of a Human who is employed by some Organization while being assigned to another Organization for some period of time to carry out some task.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Instances of SelfAssessmentValue are values that some human assigns to some aspect of her own fysical funtioning, social functioning and/or mental state.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
For a set of potential subclasses for SelfHarmEvent (e.g. BangingHead, SelfIncineration, DamagingOwnWounds) we refer to SnoMed http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/SNOMEDCT/248062006 (self-injurious behaviour).
Note that the hierarchy that subsumes this SnoMed class basically refers to events, not behavioural attributes.

Note that events in which someone hurts himself such as 'cutting finger during cooking' are only considered a SelfHarmEvent if the event is not accidental. As such, the interpretation whether some injuring event is accidental or a case of self harm fully depends on context, interpretation and intention. VPH does not make any claims here, but just provides classes for both.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: SelfHarmEvent is an IntentionalEvent where some Human deliberately harms himself due to some (temporary) substance intoxication or mental disorder.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: PubiekeDienstOrganisatie is een Organisatie die publieke diensten levert of een overheidsbeleid uitvoert en daarbij (financiele) verantwoording aflegt en/of rapporteert bij een BestuurlijkeOverheidsOrganisatie.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: ServiceOrganization is an Organization that provides some public service and is regulated by the Government or carries out some Governmental policy.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: SexualAbusiveEvent is any sexually oriented AbusiveEvent that is willfully carried out on some other Human without the consent of this other Human.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: SexualHarassmentEvent is any event where some Human willfully and intentionally makes implicit sexual remarks or overtones to some other Human, including the inappropriate promise of rewards in exchange for sexual favors without the consent of this other Human.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Sibling is the Role of some Human and corresponds to the relation someone has to another Human if both share the same Parents.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This class is added in case there is a (future) need to model and instantiate situations directly. Note however that specific situations may also be derived from data if e.g. timestamps are provided.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: A Situation is a StativePerdurant that corresponds to an impartial and time-bounded representation of a piece of reality or state of things in the world.
owl:Class.skos:example: An example of a Situation is 'Mary's owning a Ford between 2010 and 2011'.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: TO DO

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: SocialDescriptions are descriptions that depend on a community of Humans and describe or regulate some form of social interaction between Humans.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Note that not all events where Humans may interact are therefore necessarily to be interpreted as a SocialInteractionEvent. This class defines events where the focus is on some intentional interaction between humans or groups of humans only and where there is some inherent change in the world as a result of the event other than 'not happening'.
As some contrastive examples of happenings that (may) involve some (human) interaction but are not considered subclasses of SocialInteraction:
vph:Meeting is not an EventivePerdurant but considered a Process since there is no inherent result of any Meeting besides of 'meeting is over/does no longer exist'.
vph:Killing and vph:Injuring are subclasses of InternalChange and not SocialInteractionEvent as a.) they not necessarily involve only Humans interacting and b.) not all injuring and killing events are intentional.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: SocialInteractionEvent is an IntentionalEvent where Humans interact with eachother.
owl:Class.skos:example: Examples are: 'sell.v', 'help.v', 'therapeutic intervention.n', 'rape.n', etc.

owl:Class.skos:definition: Loebe (2007): A SocialRole corresponds to the involvement of a social object within some society.
dolce: A role created and maintained by a society.
owl:Class.definitionSource: Loebe, F. (2007). Abstract vs. social roles–Towards a general theoretical account of roles. Applied Ontology, 2(2), 127-158.

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Instances of SpatialValue characterize the position of some entity in a spatial dimension.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: SpatioTemporalParticular
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Instances of SpatioTemporalParticular are entities that exist in time and space.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Spouse is the Role of some Human and corresponds to the relation someone has to another Human where both contend to share intimacy and significant parts of their personal lives, while this bond is grounded in some Contract.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Also see the definition and explantion provided for the class vph:Perdurant.

Note that vph:State is different from gUFO:Situation. A situation is an impartial and time-bounded representation of a piece of reality or state of things in the world. An example may clarify the difference:
If we have an event such as: "Yesterday, John bought the car from Mary", we know that there are two different situations:
sit. 1: before yesterday, Mary owns the car and John didn't sit. 2: today, Mary no longer owns the car while John does.
Situation 1 and 2 can be described as two different gufo:Situations: "Johns owning of this car after yesterday" and "Marys owning of this car before yesterday".
Note how this is different from the concept "owning a car" that would be considered a State in VPH.
