TO DO: DEPRECATE, remove to vph:Quality? (also to ensure interoprability with gufo/istandard; otherwise perhaps too much deviation from their framework. )
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: State is a StativePerdurant that is homeomeric, i.e. parts of a State are identical to the State itself.
owl:Class.skos:example: Examples are: flourish.v, dead.a, on hold.adv, obstruct.v, function.v.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Note that StationaryArtifact and its subclasses are restricted to Artifacts only. Objects that have a fixed location but are not man-made (a river, a rock formation) are NOT StationaryArtifacts.
Also note that 'parts' of StationaryArtifacts such as a porch or a room are also StationaryArtifacts as they have a fixed spatial location (and are located within some other StationaryArtifact).
Also note that not all possible parts or componenents of some StationaryArtifact are therefore StationaryArtifacts as well. See also e.g. vph:Device, vph:EngineeringComponent and vph:Artifact.
owl:Class.skos:definition: sumo: StationaryArtifact is an Artifact that has a fixed spatial location.
owl:Class.skos:example: Examples are: house, bridge, toll booth, porch, canal, room, etc.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Also see the definition and explanation provided for the class vph:Perdurant.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: A StativePerdurant is a Perdurant that is not cumulative and does not intrinsically imply some change in the world/state of affairs.
owl:Class.skos:example: Examples are: cry.v, breathe.v, erosion.n, grow.v, imprisonment.n, abducted.a, etc

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: TO DO

An example is some recommandation value with data values such as 'xsd:high', 'xsd:yes', 'xsd:not likely', 'xsd:no answer', 'xsd:7'.
Note that the 'subjective' in SubjectiveValue does not claim anything on the truth of the values but models those values that are NOT derived with some standardized classification scale (NormativeValue) or measured with some measurement device (QuantityValue).
By definition, instances of SubjectiveValue do not express values that are intrinsic to any instance of an owl:Thing.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: This is the value space for abstract values of qualities that are derived and assigned by some cognitive agent on the basis of some subjective assessment.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Note the difference with gufo:Quantity (an objectified portion of mass) being +U and vph:Substance (-U). Portions of substance are countable and +U while substances itself are not.
cf: 'lithium' (-U)/ 'insulin' (-U) and 'lithium pill' (+U), 'insulin dose' (+U).

Substance carries no Unity (-U), meaning that instances can be considered as a mass and are typically not countable. For instance: clay plus clay is just more clay and not two clay, while cat (+U) plus cat is two cats.
When in doubt, some Natural Language checks for Unity on a candidate substance (X) can be of help:
-Can I count instances of X? If no -> likely -U. -Can I merge two instances of X into a new mass without distinctive parts? If yes -> likely -U.
owl:Class.skos:definition: sumo: Substance is a PhysicalObject "in which every part is similar to every other in every relevant respect. More precisely, something is a Substance when it has only arbitrary pieces as parts - any parts have properties which are similar to those of the whole. Note that a Substance may nonetheless have physical properties that vary. For example, the temperature, chemical constitution, density, etc. may change from one part to another. An example would be a body of water."
owl:Class.skos:example: Examples are: water, blood, clay, gold, wood, saliva, glue, vomit, sugar.

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: SuicideAttempt is a SelfHarmEvent where some Human deliberately injures himself with some degree of intent to die from this injury.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An example is the DiseaseOrSyndrom Fever that can have the role Symptom if associated with some other DiseaseOrSyndrom such as flue, meningitis and malaria.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Symptom is a role assigned to some quality that a Human experiences or detects in a bodily function and that is associated with some disease or syndrome.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: zie: FinancialTransaction. Voor bankbiljetten, munten, aandelen, vouchers, etc. Kortom: artefacten die een waarde representeren en ook (officieel) daartoe zijn erkend.

owl:Class.skos:definition: Definition: Technique is a description of the way to carry out a particular task or execute a method or procedure.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Instances of TemperatureValue express the quantity values of the physical quality Temperature.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Instances of TemporalValue are atomic regions or qualia in some value space. Our conception of TemporalValue comes close to dul:TemporalRegion where the focus is on the region, not the qualia.
Due to this difference, we defined no mapping from this class to DOLCE.

Several classes from the owl-time ontology are reused in the VPH ontology to model temporal values. Note that data and object properties will be reused from the this ontology in a later stage of the development of the VPH ontology.
Also see: https://www.w3.org/TR/owl-time/
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Instances of AbstractValue express values of temporal qualities such as durations and timepoints.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Arbeidsovereenkomst is een Overeenkomst tussen een Werknemer en een Werkgever waarbij de Werknemer in dienst van de Werkgever, voor een vooraf bepaalde tijdsperiode, enerzijds verplicht is om (persoonlijk) arbeid te verrichten en anderzijds de werkgever verplicht is loon aan de werknemer te betalen.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: TemporaryWorker is the Role of a Human who is mediated by some temporary employment agency that sends her to work in different organizations for a limited period of time.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Uitzendkracht is de rol van een Persoon die namens een Uitzendbureau arbeid verricht bij een Onderneming en daarbij onder toezicht en leiding van deze Onderneming staat.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Examples:
"Yesterday, Mary mailed THE LETTER to John." "MARY flew to New York in the newest Airbus."
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: A ThemeCaseRole is played by some Object participating in some Process as the thing that is transferred.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Cure related extensions for TherapeuticInterventions can be placed here. For this version of the VPH, we incorporated a limited number of cure related interventions that were identified for the current use case of Quality of Care in Dutch nursing homes. We refer to e.g. SnoMed for an extensive classification of TherapeuticInterventions.

Note that 'providing assistence with activities of daily living' is not considered a TherapeuticIntervention as its prime focus is not on alleviating or curing some DiseaseOrSyndrome despite that experiencing assistence may have a therapeutic effect on the PatientInCare.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: TherapeuticIntervention is any SocialInteractionEvent carried out with the intention to cure, alleviate or reduce (the symptoms of) some DiseaseOrSyndrome.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Examples are: antibiotic substance, quinine, acetylsalicylic acid, lithium, iodine, etc.

In VPH, we included a small set of therapeutic substances that are deemed important for the domain. For a structured set of (potential) subtypes to extend the hierarchy for TherapeuticSubstance, we refer to SnoMed and the NCIT:
http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/SNOMEDCT/410942007 (Drug or Medicament) http://ncicb.nci.nih.gov/xml/owl/EVS/Thesaurus.owl#C1909 ( Pharmacologic Substance)

Note that this class is for substances; for the medical products made from or with these substances, we refer to vph:PharmaceuticalArtifact.
Some TherapeuticSubstances will be man-made and could therefore erroneously be interpreted as Artifact; note however that not all man-made PhysicalObjects are necessarily Artifacts.
Note that instances of TherapeuticSubstance are not always necessarily and intrinsically therapeutic, but they can function as such within a specific context. Depending on the domain and the specific information need, one can consider e.g. 'lithium' to be an instance or subtype of ChemicalSubstance, TherapeuticSubstance or both.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: TherapeuticSubstance is a BiologicallyActiveSubstance that may have an effect in the treatment, stabilization or prevention of some PathologicalProcess in some Organism.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
In het Nederlands heeft het woord 'toilet' meerdere betekenissen waaronder 'ruimte waarin een of meerdere toiletten zijn geplaatst' en 'wc-pot'. Beide betekenissen hebben hun eigen concept: vph:ToiletRoom en vph:ToiletFixture.
De reden hiervoor is onder andere gebaseerd op specifieke terminologie binnen het zorgdomein. Bijvoorbeeld:
Een 'verhoogd toilet' duidt op een wc-pot met een extra hoog zitvlak, niet op een opgehoogde vloer. Een 'aangepast toilet' heeft doorgaans betrekking op de aanpassingen die zijn aangebracht in de ruimte waarin de wc staat zoals beugels en een alarmknop maar ook de zithoogte van de wc-pot. Met andere woorden, een wc-pot/toilet staat in/is onderdeel van een ruimte die ook als 'toilet' wordt aangeduid.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Toilet is een Object dat is bedoeld voor het wegspoelen van urine, ontlasting en bijkomend afval.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: ToiletFixture is a Device for flushing waste that is the result of human urination and defecation.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: ToiletRoom is a Room where one or multiple ToiletFixtures have been installed.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: ToiletRuimte is een Kamer waarin een of meerdere Toiletten zijn geinstalleerd.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: ToiletHulpmiddel is een Hulpmiddel dat een Persoon met een functionele beperking in staat stelt naar de wc te gaan danwel er in voorziet dat een Persoon zich anderszins kan ontlasten.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: ToilettingAssistiveDevice is a DisabilityAssistiveDevice that assists some Person with a functional disability to go to the Toilet and/or assists to relieve oneself of feces and urine.
owl:Class.skos:example: Voorbeelden zijn: urinaal, toiletstoel, urineschuitje, ondersteek, etc.

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Toxin is a poisonous BiologicallyActiveSubstance that is produced within a Cell or Organism, or man-made as a synthetic analogue.
owl:Class.skos:example: Examples are: botulinum toxin produced by the Bacterium Clostridium botulinum; staphylococcal enteretoxin B that is produced by the bacterium Staphylococcus aureus.

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Trainee is de Rol van een Persoon die na het behalen van een opleidingskwalificatie in dienst is van een Organisatie en binnen of namens deze Organisatie werkzaamheden verricht en specifieke aanvullende beroeps- of functiegerichte trainingen volgt.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Trainee is the role of some Human who undergoes training for a particular job or profession within some Organization, usually after having graduated from some educational program.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: For specific LiftingAssistiveDevices, we refer to the subclasses of Snomed "Lifting assistice device" and Snomed "Transfer/turning assistive device".
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: TransferAssistiveDevice is a DisabilityAssistiveDevice that assists in moving some Person with a functional disability from one location to another (such as from the bed to a wheelchair) or from one physical position into another physical position.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: TransferHulpmiddel is een Hulpmiddel waarmee een Persoon met een functionele beperking kan worden verplaatst van de ene locatie naar een andere locatie zoals van bed naar rolstoel of waarmee de lichaamspositie van een Persoon kan worden gewijzigd.
owl:Class.skos:example: Voorbeelden zijn tillift, bedpapegaai, draailaken, beenlifter, draaikussen, transferplank, toiletbeugel.

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: TransferEvent is a Translocation where the agent and patient of the Translocation are played by different PhysicalObjects.
owl:Class.skos:example: Examples: 'he drove the woman to the hospital', 'the nurse pushed the files away', 'the housekeeping staff removed the old tables', 'they evacuated the hospital', 'she flew to New York', 'she sent the letter yesterday'.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: TO DO: (zelfde persoon in nieuwe functie binnen zelfde organisatie). Met als subklassen: demotie-event en promotie-event.

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Translocation is an EventivePerdurant where some PhysicalObject moves from one location to another location.
http://www.ontologyportal.org/translations/SUMO.owl.txt#Translocation
owl:Class.skos:example:
For body motions that are not focused primarily on changing location, we refer to vph:Motion and its subclasses. Examples of body motions are: 'raise arm', 'bend knee', etc.
(Modeling these as qualities instead is still taken into consideration.)
examples: 'arrival.n', 'depart.v', 'moving residence.v', 'evacuate.v', 'trespassing.v', 'falling.v', 'dropping an object.v', 'travel.n', 'dispersal.n', etc.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: For a set of potential domain-specific concepts for transportation, we refer to SnoMed http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/SNOMEDCT/384762007 (Transportation procedure) and its subclasses. Note however, that VPH also allows to model the event and its TransportationDevice playing the role of vph:InstrumentCaseRole. This way, one prevents the proliferation of finegrained subclasses based on 'means of transportation' as is done in SnoMed.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Transportation is an TransferEvent where some PhysicalObject moves from one location to another location by means of some TransportationDevice.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: TransportationDevice is a Device that acts as an Instrument in the Translocation of PhysicalObjects from one Location to another Location.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Transportmiddel is een fysiek en mensgemaakt Middel dat wordt gebruikt om FysiekeObjecten zoals personen en goederen van een Locatie naar een andere Locatie te verplaatsen.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Bratexband is een MobiliteitsBeperkendMiddel waarbij een Persoon door een band om een deel van de torso wordt gefixeerd aan een bed of stoel.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Instances of UnitOfCurrency are units for money in common use, especially for people in some nation.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Also see: vph:TemporalValue

Domain-specific units of volume such as '40 hour workweek' and '36 hour workweek' will also be instances of this class. This allows to say e.g. that some institution A has three employees with a fulltime contract using '36 hour workweek' as unit of measure while institution B has three employees with a fulltime contract but uses the unit of measure '40 hour workweek'.
Note that the instance '36 hour workweek' has two different meanings: a.) a unit of duration and b.) a specific DurationValue. The difference can also be illustrated with two contrastive example sentences:
'We employ a 36 hour workweek for deriving how many full time positions we have at this institution" versus 'Mary has a 36 hour workweek but her collegue works only 12 hours a week" (duration value)

Instances of this class can be used to form instances of time durations; the unit 'day' can be used to form 'six days'. Note that the ontology will enable to express that 'six' is dataValueType of some DurationValue for which the UnitOfDuration 'day' is used.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: UnitOfDuration represents the standardized units of time such as 'minute' and 'hour'.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: UnitOfLength represents the standardized units of length such as 'inch' and 'nanometer'.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: UnitOfMass represents the standardized units of mass such as 'kilo' and 'ounce'.

SUMO: A standard of measurement for some dimension. For example, the Meter is a UnitOfMeasure for the dimension of length, as is the Inch. There is no intrinsic property of a UnitOfMeasure that makes it primitive or fundamental, rather, a system of units (e.g. SystemeInternationalUnit) defines a set of orthogonal dimensions and assigns units for each.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: UnitOfTemperature represents the standardized units of temperature such as 'Celsius' and 'Fahrenheit'.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: UnitOfVolume represents the standardized units of volume such as 'Liter' and 'Milliliter'.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
A domain-specific example of a CompositeUnitOfMeasure is UnitOfWorkload with its instance 'FTE' or 'Full-time equivalent'. This is a unit of measure for workloads and can be defined as "the number of total hours worked divided by the maximum number of compensable hours in a full-time schedule as defined by law" (source:Wikipedia).
Since the full-time schedule may vary within the Cure domain, this ontology provides additional units of measure to state that e.g. '0.8' is a data value of some QuantityValue and that it uses the CompositeUnitOfMeasure 'FTE' and the NonCompositeUnitOfMeasure '38 hours workweek'.
Also see the notes for vph:UnitOfDuration.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Instances of UnitOfWorkload are units for the amount of work over a given period.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Voorbeelden zijn: fiets, zeilboot, skateboard, rolstoel, handrolstoel, kinderwagen, etc.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: OngemotoriseerdVervoersmiddel is een Vervoersmiddel zonder motor of accu dat geheel en alleen wordt aangedreven door spierkracht van mens of dier of door de kracht van de wind.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: UnpoweredVehicle is a Vehicle that has no engine or some power component but is powered solely by the force of some living being or by the force of wind.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Examples: flock of sheep, military convoy, musical group, football team, a family.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: VariableCollection is a Collection that carries an intensional Identity criterion, meaning that the Identity of the Collection is not defined by its members. I.e.: members can move in our out of the Collection without changing the Identity of the Collection.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Vervoersmiddel is een Transportmiddel voor de verplaatsing van FysiekeObjecten zoals personen en goederen waarbij het Transportmiddel zelf meeverplaatst van een beginlocatie naar een eindlocatie.

sumo: "Vehicle is the subclass of TransportationDevices that transport passengers or goods from one place to another by moving from one place to the other with them, e.g., cars, trucks, ferries, and airplanes. Contrast with devices such as pipelines, escalators, or supermarket checkout belts, which carry items from one place to another by means of a moving part, without the device removing from the origin to the destination.")

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Dit is de 'vestiging' als bedoeld in het Handelsregister en kan naar KIK-gedeelte van de ontologie.
Daarbij dan: equivalent to *hasFormalIdentifierDescription some vph:KVK_IdentifierDescription. (onderscheidend kenmerk en minimaal 1).
Waarbij de desgewenst kan worden gespecificeerd als HoofdAdres of NevenAdres, etc. Zie subklassen van vph:Address_Description.
also see: vph:DomicileDescription
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: VillageOrCity is a GeopoliticalArea occupied by a permanent human settlement.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Note that ViolantInteraction does not impose any perspective on either the agent or the patient of some event. In other words: 'two people fighting eachother' and 'Mary assaulted John' can both be labeled as ViolentInteraction events.
We refer to vph:Participant and its subclasses for roles that can be applied to instantiate e.g. the agent and patient of some ViolentInteraction.

Note that the result of some AbusiveEvent may induce the change of some internal quality of some Human, though this is not always and necessarily the case for every instance. This is one of the disciminitive features between instances of ViolentInteraction/AbusiveEvent and InternalChange.
Note however, that some event can be labeled as e.g. vph:Injuring and PhysicalAbusiveEvent if applicable and desirable in some context.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: ViolentInteraction is a SocialInteractionEvent in which some Human or GroupOfHumans intentionally and willfully (attempts to) cause some form of harm to some other Human or GroupOfHumans.
owl:Class.skos:example: Examples are: terrorist attacks, war, sexual assault, sexual harassment, gaslighting, negligant events, a caregiver hitting some patient, some patient biting some caregiver.

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: VirtualArea is an Area that simulates or is perceived by humans as an Area but exists only digitally.
owl:Class.skos:example: Some VirtualAreas can be identified with a VirtualAddressDescription, i.e. IP adresses, webpage addresses, etc.

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: VirtualPlaceDescription is a LocalizablePlaceDescription that is used to identify some virtual place by means of some Description, i.e. a homepage, an e-mail address, an IP address, etc.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: There is an ongoing debate whether Virus should be considered an Organism or not. Here, we made the pragmatic decision to model Virus as an Organism based on their ability to reproduce.
owl:Class.skos:definition: sumo: Virus is "an Organism consisting of a core of a single nucleic acid enclosed in a protective coat of protein. A virus may replicate only inside a host living cell. A virus exhibits some but not all of the usual characteristics of living things."
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: VisualContentBearingObject is a ContentBearingObject that is intended to convey meaning as the result visual interpretation.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Vitamin is a Nutrient that is necessary to maintain the normal functioning of the metabolism of some Animal.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: TO DO

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Instances of VolumeValue express the quantity values of the physical quality Volume.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: VoluntaryCaregiver
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: A VoluntaryCaregiver is someone who provides long term care for a family member, friend or acquintance on a voluntary basis.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Een Mantelzorger is iemand die langdurig, vrijwillig en onbetaald voor een chronisch zieke, gehandicapte of hulpbehoevende partner, (schoon)ouder, kind of ander familielid, vriend of kennis zorgt.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Euthanasieverklaring is een beschrijving waarin een Persoon een verzoek tot toekomstige euthanasie doet in het geval van bepaalde ziektes en aandoeningen indien de Persoon zelf geen beslissingen meer kan nemen over medische behandelingen of zijn eigen gezondheid door wilsonbekwaamheid veroorzaakt door ziekte of aandoeningen.

Nederlands Wetboek, Wtlvhz, artikel 2: "Indien de patiënt van zestien jaren of ouder niet langer in staat is zijn wil te uiten, maar voordat hij in die staat geraakte tot een redelijke waardering van zijn belangen ter zake in staat werd geacht, en een schriftelijke verklaring, inhoudende een verzoek om levensbeëindiging, heeft afgelegd, dan kan de arts aan dit verzoek gevolg geven."
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Volunteer is the Role of some Human who freely offers to undertake a task or works for some organization without financial compensation for this labour.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Wachtlijst is een fysiek of digitaal Document waarin, volgens bepaalde ordeningsprincipes, de namen van Personen zijn opgenomen die wachten op het ontvangen van een dienst of bepaalde goederen.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: WaitingList is a physical or digital Document that contains a list of person names, ordered via some ordering principle, who are waiting to receive some goods or services.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: WaterArea is a GeographicArea that predominantly consists of water in a fluid or solid state.
owl:Class.skos:example: Examples are: ocean, river, sea, lake, harbor.

owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Groothandel is een Handelsonderneming die FysiekeObjecten verkoopt aan Organisaties en niet aan individuele Personen.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: WholesaleOrganization is a MercantileOrganization that sells PhysicalObjects to Organizations and not to individual Persons.
http://www.ontologyportal.org/translations/SUMO.owl.txt#WholesaleStore

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Ondernemingsraad is een Medezeggenschapsorganisatie die bestaat uit Werknemers van een Organisatie die namens de overige Werknemers overleg voeren met Personen die de leiding hebben over de Organisatie over het Beleid en de belangen van de Werknemers.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: WorkCounsil is a CoDeterminationOrganization in which Employees of some Organization represent the interests of all Employees and discuss topics regarding management and policies proposed by the management team of the Organization.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Werkadres / Optioneel
TO DO
Worker represents the most neutral concept for anyone who carries out some task, irrespective of labour laws and the existence of e.g. an employment contract.
owl:Class.skos:definition: EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: Worker identifies the role of some Human that carries out some task, either acting under orders of someone else and with some financial compensation or out of one's own free will and without any compensation.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: WoundCareTherapeuticIntervention is a TherapeuticIntervention carried out with the intention to care for some Wound in such way that the condition of the Wound stabilizes or improves.
EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: WoundDebridement is a WoundCareTherapeuticIntervention where infected and/or necrotic tissue is removed with the intention to stabilize or improve the condition of some Wound.

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: WoundHealingProcess is an AutonomousHealingProcess where the biological functions in some Organism autonomously regenerate the tissue that was damaged or lost due to some DiseaseOrSyndrome, some InjuringEvent or some TherapeuticIntervention.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Also see (Dutch only): https://www.rijksoverheid.nl/onderwerpen/arbeidsovereenkomst-en-cao/vraag-en-antwoord/welke-contracten-zijn-er-voor-oproepkrachten

EDITORIAL_DEFINITION: NulUrenArbeidscontract is een Arbeidscontract waarin uitdrukkelijk geen afspraken zijn vastgelegd over het aantal uren dat een Werknemer oproepbaar is voor het verrichten van werkzaamheden.
Alternative to time:DurationDescription to support description of a temporal duration other than using a calendar/clock system.
owl:Class.skos:definition: time:Duration of a temporal extent expressed as a decimal number scaled by a temporal unit.

time: Description of temporal extent structured with separate values for the various elements of a calendar-clock system. The temporal reference system is fixed to Gregorian Calendar, and the range of each of the numeric properties is restricted to xsd:decimal.
time: A temporal entity with zero extent or duration.
time: A temporal entity with an extent or duration.
time: A temporal entity with non-zero extent or duration, i.e. for which the value of the beginning and end are different.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: De aandoening 'decubitus' als aanwezig in een Organisme, dus niet de individuele doorligplekken (zie:vph:PressureUlcer). Let op: 'decubitus' is een specifiek Nederlandse term!
